text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the court shall act only if the arbitral tribunal cannot act effectively at the time of the application. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under the section discussing s44 of the Arbitration Act 1996, stating: 'Relief is available if it is urgent, the tribunal cannot be approached promptly, or other exceptional circumstances apply.' This directly reflects the requirement that the court's power is conditional on the tribunal's inability or impracticality to act effectively.", "criterion_id": "99bd5e85-c863-444f-96b7-f20fdf0e4b8d"}
